scopecontent.p: This is an artificial collection created by HSP staff, containing manuscript materials from many sources.The collection contains a range of papers, organized by topic, that document a variety of aspects of American life--from finance to slavery, from music to war. Subjects documented include colonial and early republic Philadelphia government, business, and associations, churches, schools and colleges, libraries, watermarks, sanitation, the Whiskey Rebellion, the Mexican War, the War of 1812 and the Civil War, American Indians, slavery and manumission. Documents include correspondence, military papers such as muster rolls, petitions, transportation-related articles such as tickets and passports, leases and deeds, bonds, stock certificates, receipt books, legal papers, broadsides, and musical scores. Also included are several envelopes of 18th and 19th century currency. A few documents are in French and Dutch and there are some photostats, photocopies, and facsimiles in lieu of original documents.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
